channel.title: Blender scripts
channel.description: I'm trying to model something for source in blender, and I found a good tutorial, which links to a .SMD exporter. The only problem is that I can't find the .blender and the scripts folder. I've looked online already and I can't find any solution, so if anyone knows what to do, please tell me.

item.title: Blender scripts
item.dc:creator: Brother_Shrike
item.description:
you can probably google for it.

Read full topic

item.title: Blender scripts
item.dc:creator: Firebringer
item.description:
Brother Shrike:

so just check what directory blender saves your files in by default. If it uses the appdata or whatever directory, your scripts will probably be in there. On XP it’s C:\documents and settings\username\Application Data\Blender Foundation\Blender.blender\scripts

Application Data may be a hidden folder, but if you haven’t already, you should disable hidden folders. Tools->Folder Options->View or display or something.

Thanks, that worked, now my only problem is compiling, it says that vstdlib.dll is not found.

Read full topic

item.title: Blender scripts
item.dc:creator: Brother_Shrike
item.description:
so just check what directory blender saves your files in by default. If it uses the appdata or whatever directory, your scripts will probably be in there. On XP it’s C:\documents and settings\username\Application Data\Blender Foundation\Blender.blender\scripts

Application Data may be a hidden folder, but if you haven’t already, you should disable hidden folders. Tools->Folder Options->View or display or something.

item.title: Blender scripts
item.dc:creator: Brother_Shrike
item.description:
Iblis:

if its not in there it will be in
C:\Users\your name or whatever your logged into\appdata\roaming\blenderfoundation\blender.blender\scripts
(the appdata folder will mostlikely be hidden unless you have unlocked to see all hidden folders

Assuming he has vista…

item.title: Blender scripts
item.dc:creator: Brother_Shrike
item.description:
C:\program files\blender foundation\blender.blender\scripts. Should be there. Otherwise, check where blender saves your files and find the scripts folder in that folder.

Read full topic
